title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:00 <Enygma`> has quit

02:16 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:40 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
02:40 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
02:46 <DrLou> has quit  
03:13 <+cjdelisle> Digging through the way tests work, looking at ClasspathSuite, this is how I did it: http://cjdns.pastebay.com/117380  
03:43 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
03:44 <venkatesh> has quit

05:38 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
06:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:33 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
07:44 <+cjdelisle> I was kind of curious to see what it was going to do. xoffice doesn't strike me as the kind of thing that people would want to blank.  
07:44 <vmassol> yeah  
07:44 <vmassol> I've removed it  
07:44 <vmassol> too fast  
07:44 <+cjdelisle> Oh there was spam before I saw it?  
07:45 <vmassol> sorry we couldn't see what it was going to do  
07:45 <vmassol> I remove after emily brown blanked it  
07:45 <vmassol> I removed her 2 versions  
07:45 <vmassol> s/remove/revmoed/  
07:45 <+cjdelisle> hehe girls name + number, I almost called it but I thought it would be rude if I was wrong :)  
07:47 <vmassol> got to go to the office  
07:47 <vmassol> bbl  
07:47 <vmassol> has quit  
08:50 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <vmassol> back  
09:15 <+cjdelisle> I forgot to declare a dependency on store again :(  
09:15 <vmassol> you mean it's not bundled?  
09:15 <+cjdelisle> Yes.  
09:15 <vmassol> put it in web/standard  
09:15 <+cjdelisle> I just did, compiling now and testing to make sure I don't break anything then I'll commit.  
09:17 <+cjdelisle> I'm not sure how best to test this but my thinking at the moment is I should use apache httpclient to interact with the wiki.  
09:17 <vmassol> sounds good  
09:18 <+cjdelisle> I wish I could drop the tests into the running wiki engine and have the interact with the code but I can't figure out how.  
09:22 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <sburjan> has quit  
09:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <stephan\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <stephan\_> Hello. the parent/Child Navigation on Enterprise 2.7 seems not to work correct. Before creating a new page, the url ends with ?parent=... but after thispart of the url is gone. is it a known bug?  
11:52 <+sburjan> Hello. is Jenkins working all right ?  
12:06 <stephan\_> has quit  
12:11 <mflorea> has quit  
12:12 <Chris\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <Chris\_> is now known as <Guest2518>  
12:14 <Guest2518> Hello. I am looking for a way to download multiple attachments from an xwiki site. Does someone know if this is possible? Has anyone found a solution for this issue? Thanks, chris  
12:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:16 <ihalip\_> is now known as <ihalip>  
12:25 <+cjdelisle> You mean to download multiple attachments in one request?  
12:26 <+cjdelisle> Downloading multiple attachments alone is trivial if you click on one attachment then the other so I assume there must be more to what you are asking.  
12:29 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:32 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
12:35 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <Guest2518> What we do is that we have for example an information page with up to 300 Documents attached to it. Of course the user could just save all the necessary documents by clicking on it or doing a right click and choo "save as". This is rather annoying, though. So what I am looking for is some sort of checkbox infront of the attachment where I would be able to choose which documents to download and then press download and I get for exampl  
12:45 <+cjdelisle> irc message sizes are limited.    "press download and I get for exampl|<-- cut off here  
12:46 <Guest2518> ....example a zip file with all the requested documents....  
12:47 <+cjdelisle> Creating a zip file from a group of documents. It could be done but there is no existing extension to do it.  
13:01 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:01 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <vmassol> has quit  
13:20 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <Guest2518> That's too bad. I was hoping there would be an easy solution.  
13:30 <+cjdelisle> It is not difficult, it just requires some development.  
13:31 <abusenius> has quit  
13:31 <+cjdelisle> I think it could be done using a groovy script in the wiki page.  
13:55 <arkub> has quit  
13:57 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <vmassol> cjdelisle: trying filesystem attachments now  
14:02 <vmassol> cjdelisle: btw question: if I was using the DB and I switch to FS, do I get to see the attachments that are in the DB?  
14:04 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'm not sure about putting the WYSIWYG editor config section in the L&F group. Not all config props are related to L&F. Now, if we agree to put in in a group other than Applications then it's ugly because right now ConfigurableClass doesn't allow you to specify a group (all configurables are automatically placed in the Application group).  
14:04 <vmassol> mflorea: all I know is that it looked strange to me that it was in the Applications section  
14:05 <+mflorea> it was put there automatically because I used the Configurable xclass  
14:06 <+mflorea> I see there also "Search Suggest" which is neither an application  
14:06 <+mflorea> Message Stream will be there too  
14:09 <+mflorea> IMO the best group for WYSIWYG editor among the existing ones is "Configuration" but I can't place my section there without modifying the administration sheet, excluding my configurable object from the list of configurable apps that go in the "Applications" group.  
14:12 <vmassol> mflorea: maybe that's something to improve for 3.1 but it seems we need "Configurable" feature to support specifying the config category somehow  
14:12 <+mflorea> yep  
14:13 <vmassol> cjdelisle: could you review this: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise30M3#HFilesystemAttachmentStore ?  
14:15 <vmassol> hmmm maybe xwiki.store.attachment.recyclebin.hint=file is needed too  
14:15 <vmassol> probably  
14:19 <vmassol> cjdelisle: actually doesn't work… I have my logs filled with http://pastebin.com/XfHVmQbr It never stops  
14:43 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <vmassol> sburjan: on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/ManualTestReportXE30RC1 do you test the new features?  
15:27 <vmassol> ie the ones listed in the release notes  
15:28 <+sburjan> vmassol: ofc. give me 10 minute and it will be ready,so you can take a look  
15:28 <vmassol> ok  
15:28 <vmassol> cool  
15:46 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <vmassol> fyi going to deploy jmock 2.6RC2 on our remote repo since it's not on central  
15:47 <vmassol> (jmock 2.6 is the version that is compatible with junit 4.7/4.8)  
15:48 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: There's a failing test that you should solve, did you know?  
15:48 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yes I know  
15:49 <+tmortagne> i was refactoring the tests to not use remote repositories anymore but I found a blocker bug in aether repository  
15:49 <@sdumitriu> The fact that you can't read the packaging type?  
15:50 <vmassol> has quit  
15:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:53 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yes  
15:53 <+tmortagne> that make the repository module try to download jar files instead of xar files when trying to install a xar  
16:01 <+sburjan> @all : http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/ManualTestReportXE30RC1  
16:01 <+sburjan> you can start fixing or closing  
16:02 <+sburjan> vmassol: I haven't got the change to test yet wysiwyg admin section. I will do it tomorrow  
16:02 <SvenDowideit\_> has quit  
16:05 <vmassol> sburjan: reading  
16:06 <vmassol> sburjan: have you test filesystem attahcment store?  
16:06 <vmassol> I don't see it  
16:06 <+sburjan> Nop, I didn't tested. I didn't had time nor specifications on what to test  
16:07 <vmassol> ah ok thought you said that you tested all new features in the RN....  
16:07 <vmassol> live search?  
16:07 <vmassol> macro support in webkit-based browsers?  
16:07 <vmassol> extension manager?  
16:08 <+sburjan> I tsted Dashboards, User Status, Following users  
16:08 <vmassol> items under "Miscellaneous" in the RN?  
16:08 <vmassol> hmmm ok so we miss quite a few tests  
16:08 <+sburjan> Tomorrow is another day  
16:09 <+sburjan> I'll be here  
16:09 <vmassol> you're planning to test them too?  
16:09 <vmassol> I just need to ensure someone tests them  
16:10 <+sburjan> yes, but I need some specs to know what to test. For example I thought cjdelisle's storage engine is invisible for end user  
16:10 <vmassol> why does that matter?  
16:10 <vmassol> it's a feature we release  
16:10 <vmassol> and it has to work  
16:10 <vmassol> for me QA is not limited to visible  
16:10 <vmassol> end users will definitely see it  
16:10 <vmassol> if it doesn't work  
16:10 <vmassol> ;)  
16:11 <vmassol> (an admin configures it and then users user it)  
16:11 <vmassol> s/user/use/  
16:11 <vmassol> re specs you can do basic testing to start with  
16:11 <+sburjan> if not be sure I'll ask  
16:11 <vmassol> then you can ask here or on the list if you need help  
16:12 <vmassol> yep  
16:12 <+sburjan> I see that Filesystem Attachment Store isn't enabled by default  
16:12 <vmassol> yep  
16:12 <+sburjan> I concentrated on User status and Dashboards .. on 4 browsers  
16:13 <+sburjan> took some time :)  
16:13 <vmassol> I'm sure it does!  
16:13 <vmassol> again it's a question of knowing for me who can test stuff. If you don't have the time it's fine but I need to know to find someone else who can do it  
16:13 <+sburjan> even if the number of issues isn't big, I tested a lot ;)  
16:14 <vmassol> sure sure you're doing a good job  
16:14 <+sburjan> no no, I will test those tomorrow.  
16:14 <vmassol> ok great  
16:14 <vmassol> thanks  
16:14 <+sburjan> but I'm sure I'll have questions regarding storage :)  
16:14 <+sburjan> and IMO this is very miportant. http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6105  
16:14 <+sburjan> \*important  
16:15 <+sburjan> a thing that's not gonna get away if you don't decide  
16:17 <vmassol> i don't know if there's a way for the dashboard to prevent this  
16:17 <vmassol> without having to change the gadget content itself  
16:17 <vmassol> lucaa: ?  
16:27 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
16:28 <+sburjan> either allow resizable macros, either enlarge gadget columns, but this would create a horizontal ruler, which IMO is not so cool  
16:28 <+sburjan> \*resizable gadgets  
16:29 <vmassol> right now we have 1 implementation only: fixed sized layout  
16:29 <vmassol> you can add a wish to have a resizable layout in jira  
16:29 <vmassol> the only thing we need to fix for 3.0 final IMO is to prevent the overflowing  
16:31 <+sburjan> there are multiple possible solutions .. we should start a discussion. Not saying we need this fixed for 3.0, but we won't escape if we don't chose a solution  
16:31 <vmassol> as I said we can have several layouts  
16:32 <vmassol> there's no single best solution  
16:32 <vmassol> the container macro is built to support layouts  
16:32 <+sburjan> yes but if you check the issue, there is a screenshot which overlaps with only 2 columns  
16:32 <vmassol> and?  
16:32 <vmassol> "the only thing we need to fix for 3.0 final IMO is to prevent the overflowing"  
16:32 <vmassol> is that different?  
16:32 <+sburjan> and for example Office Preview is out of range  
16:32 <+sburjan> no  
16:33 <vmassol> practically this means scroll bars for a fixed layout  
16:33 <+sburjan> but it's not like I added 10 columns and have this issue. I have this issue with only 2 columns. this is what I wanted to point out :P  
16:33 <vmassol> again we can talk about having other layouts in the future  
16:33 <+sburjan> yepp  
16:33 <vmassol> but right now for 3.0 final we should make the fixed size one work  
16:40 <sburjan> has quit  
16:41 <fmancinelli> I've noticed that a lot of directories in the XWiki ZIP distribution are 777 (rwxrwxrwx). This could lead to security issues (http://pastebin.com/vx0rjbgC)  
16:41 <vmassol> hmmm it's possible this got broken when I updated the assmebly plugin usage  
16:42 <vmassol> normally we're setting the those  
16:42 <vmassol> let me check  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> Yep, it's a bug  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> I reported it  
16:42 <@sdumitriu> http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MASSEMBLY-422  
16:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: AFAIR I had used a workaround in the past  
16:43 <vmassol> but it's possible I removed it while upgrading to the new assemblyu plugin  
16:48 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <vmassol> hmm this might have been caused by http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5667  
16:48 <lucaa> has quit  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> No, this is ancient  
16:49 <vmassol> well is the perm issue more recent?  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> No  
16:49 <@sdumitriu> I reported it on 08/Jun/09  
16:49 <Guest2518> has quit  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> And it was happening before that  
16:50 <vmassol> I remember doing something in our build for fixing permissions  
16:50 <vmassol> I don't remember where though  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> It used to be way before that when the .sh didn't have the execute right  
16:51 <@sdumitriu> Are you talking about something else  
16:51 <@sdumitriu> ?  
16:51 <vmassol> hmm no it might be for the sh files indeed  
16:57 <lucaa1> has quit  
17:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <fmancinelli> quick question: what is the API called by the autosave feature? Is it Document.save(java.lang.String comment, boolean minorEdit) ?  
17:21 <@sdumitriu> It just call the save action  
17:22 <@sdumitriu> It's no API  
17:27 <fmancinelli> sdumitriu: ok, so if I check the minor edit checkbox it will autosave minor edits otherwise it will autosave full versions  
17:36 <fmancinelli> sdumitriu: actually autosave saves as minor edits.  
17:36 <gsauthier> has quit  
17:40 <@sdumitriu> Yes, always
